definitions: remaining after the greater part or quantity has gone

examples.text: the withdrawal of residual occupying forces

shortDefinitions: remaining after greater part or quantity has gone

definitions: (of a quantity) left after other things have been subtracted

examples.text: residual income after tax and mortgage payments

shortDefinitions: (of quantity) left after other items have been subtracted

definitions: (of a physical state or property) remaining after the removal of or present in the absence of a causative agent
shortDefinitions: (of physical state or property) remaining after removal of or present in absence of causative agent

definitions: (of an experimental or arithmetical error) not accounted for or eliminated.
shortDefinitions: (of experimental or arithmetical error) not accounted for or eliminated

definitions: (of a soil or other deposit) formed in situ by weathering.
shortDefinitions: (of soil or other deposit) formed in situ by weathering

definitions: a quantity remaining after other things have been subtracted or allowed for.
shortDefinitions: quantity remaining after other things have been subtracted or allowed for

definitions: a difference between a value measured in a scientific experiment and the theoretical or true value.
shortDefinitions: difference between value measured in scientific experiment

definitions: a royalty paid to a performer, writer, etc., for a repeat of a play, television show, etc.
shortDefinitions: royalty paid to performer, writer, etc., for repeat of play, television show

definitions: a portion of rocky or high ground remaining after erosion.
shortDefinitions: portion of rocky or high ground remaining after erosion

definitions: the resale value of a new car or other item at a specified time after purchase, expressed as a percentage of its purchase price.
shortDefinitions: resale value of new car or other item at specified time after purchase
